decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and documents: AMER02LG-10ftHC Proposed Plant Room Elevations; C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0051 Rev 3 Site Location Plan; C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0052 Rev 1 Existing Plan View; C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0053 Rev 3 DSL Proposed Boreholes Plan View and Elevations; C-2020-877-PR-DRW-0054 Rev 1 DSL Proposed Replacement Container Plan View and Elevations; DWG01 Proposed Plant Room Layout; DWG02 Proposed Concrete Pad Layout Plan; KT/PLAN/P21-971 Covering Letter prepared by Vail Williams LLP dated 2 July 2021; Lampoassa Eli60 Data Sheet; Planning Application University of West London Drama Studio London prepared by University of West London dated 7 May 2021; Measurement & Verification Plan prepared by Ameresco dated 16 March 2021.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used for the development shall be in accordance with the materials stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and Ealing Green Conservation Area Management Plan. | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the external rating noise level emitted from plant/machinery/equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/mechanical installations, together with mitigation measures as appropriate. The measures shall ensure that the external rating noise level LAeq emitted will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by 10dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver locations at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all plant/equipment operating together at maximum capacity. A post installation sound assessment shall be carried out where required to confirm compliance with the noise criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation/ use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to the use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to the first use of the ground source heat pumps, an assessment of the analysis process as laid out in the Measurement & Verification Plan prepared by Ameresco dated 16 March 2021 shall be submitted to the local planning authority. The Annual Total Avoided Energy Use Analysis of the M&V Plan should be submitted to the Council during the monitoring period.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies SI1, S2 and SI3 of the London Plan 2021, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Following the end of the use of the Ground Source Heat Pump, the Ground Source Heat Pump and associated infrastructure shall be removed from the site:

Reason: To ensure that the development does not harm the character of the Conservation Area, in accordance with policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding any information submitted, prior to the occupation of the development full details of the fence and planting include its species, number of plants and size at the time of planting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

The approved works shall be carried out prior to the switch on of the ground source heat pump or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the Conservation Area, to ensure appropriately landscaped amenity space and public realm, in accordance with policies D4, D8 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), and policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
subdivision_of_building: external works in the grounds to the front and side of property.
description: Installation of Ground Source Heat Pump system with plant enclosure outbuilding and associating fence and landscaping

application_details.scheme_name: University of West London Decarbonisation project - Drama Studio London

waste_details.reason_for_no_provision: No units proposed application ground source heat pump system
